ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to have a conversation in french.

1. I learned that learning can be fun and creative 
2. I learned that making mistakes when you speak is not the worst thing that can happen
3. I learned that sometimes learning a textbook language and learning an actual language are two different skills
I developed my grammar and conversational skills tremendously in this course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
overall, 
I thought that how we went over whole chapters and assignments might have been too fast. It is hard to retain knowledge when you go over it that fast. 

But, the strength is our casual conversations in class. I feel like this semester I was finally able to break some of my speaking barrier.
I think this course was very helpful for developing speaking skills as we were forced to have many in class conversations.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would, because the French Department people of Yale are excellent and responsive educators.
Yes I would recommend this course. I found it very engaging and I thought I was able to improve a lot of my french writing, grammatical, and speaking skills within the semester.
